Displays beautifully presented. This was one of the highlights of our visit to Barcelona. Not too busy; comfortable to stroll round. Paintings and sculptures are beautifully displayed. Allow a couple of hours.
Top Tier Art Museum. The museum has an exceptional collection and it is well arranged. The building is wonderful and the fountains in the front are awesome and picture worthy.

Don't miss it. Outstanding structure in a great location. A bit out of the way, but well worth the effort to get there. The architecture is stunning, classical -- what everyone envisions when thinking of grandiose Spanish palaces. Don't miss it.

Pickpocket. I'm very grateful because it was my first experience to visit Spain. My friends and I went to this museum on the second day in Barcelona. The view was insane!!! but unfortunately my friend lost her wallet there. she - my friend - remembered that there was a group of young female teenagers come and have a chit chat with her, some of the girls were in her back so she couldn't see how they did the 'action'. my friend realised that after we left the museum
Favorite Place. For sure is my favorite view of Barcelona! Even if you dont like visiting museums you should go there to just enjoy this amazing view! You wont regret it!

Beautiful Collection of Catalunyan History. Beautiful museum! We really enjoyed the museum.. It is beautiful. The audio cassette was great for the Gothic period and then we don't know why...but there is barely any audio after that. None-the-less... It is a beautiful place with an unbelievable view!
Walk all the way up to the top for a nice view. Didn't get a chance to go inside, but just walking up the steps to the entrance of the museum gives you a beautiful view of Barcelona :)

A Must See in Barcelona. We did not have time to go inside this mammoth museum, but it is worth going to just see it. It is part of the Montjuic attractions anyway which easily can take up a day and are well worth the time. This museum is breathtaking with cascading waterfalls and views to die for. We took the cable car all the way up and then worked our way down to this gorgeous site. Go here!
Large and inspiring. Visited at 3.30 no queues. The place is massive much like the Louvre. Loads to see. Caught the hop and stop bus there. Otherwise a bit out of the city.

Romanesque Art Perhaps Unrivaled in World. Museum lovers should not miss this museum built in 1929. Its Romanesque collection of altars and frescoes may be unmatched in the world....the length to which the Museum has gone to display them well is certainly unmatched. Inside, the museum has constructed naves and apses to mimic the settings from which the art was rescued. My husband and I were astounded at this Museum (which was free for us as seniors!) I belong to the Met and to the MFA in Boston, have visited museums all over the U.S. and Europe and find this one, for its speciality, ranks among my favorites.

Beautiful building. This is a magnificent building, well worth a visit just to see the views over Barcelona from its many levels. the building provided the backdrop for the single " Barcelona" by Freddie Mercury an Monserrat Cabalier ?? it is also well worth a visit to see the magnificent fountains which come alive at night in colours and action, Dancing Fountains

Great place. this a very unique museum, it has a great collection and the place by itself is really beautiful, it is located in a high location so you can see the whole city, as many museums it has different hidden stories like the four columns on the front or the fountains. great place to visit and it is located close to other attractions like the mall, pueblo espanol and olympic village, and montjuic castle so you can plan your trip with all these in mind.

Great museum!. Great museum. We got here around 2 pm so we did not get to do the tour so we just toured the building from the outside. Great view of barcelona city if you make it to the top! Great getaway and just steps across from the arena mall

Brilliant place to visit on a rainy day. Excellent museum, particularly if you like religious artwork. Best to get an audio guide which will explain the exhibits, especially if you can't speak/read Spanish. Be prepared to spend 3 or 4 hours there.

Great if you like medieval/Renaissance art.. As a medieval-Renaissance buff, this museum ticked both boxes. Good modern selection, but I would have liked a few more Miro's. Cafe is very expensive so being your own lunch and sit on the benches in the central cupola/rotunda and just enjoy the surroundings. The building is a wonderful mix of the old and new and from the front plaza you have a wonderful view over Barcelona,

Really Good. We took the Metro-Teleferico connection to Mt. Juic, and walked 15 minutes to the museum. As Seniors, there was no entry fee. There is a broad collection of all kindsof art, including lots of frescoes that have been saved. Huge place for which you needat least 2 hours. Patio in the front has nice views of the city. We were there on a crowded Sat. in Sept., yet the museum did not seem congested. Highly recommended.

Borring. I am not a fan of museum so i went to visit it in the first sunday of the month when there is no entrance fee.You do not pay the ticked every sunday after 3 pm and the whole first sunday of the month.Overall for those who like history and art it is a must stop at barcelona.Surely the view from up there is impressive,so taking 1000 stairs is worth it

Not quite what we expected.. The museum itself was not impressive. I did not find their collection that interesting. However the exterior is totally amazing and the views of Barcelona worth the trip. Believe it or not they have escallators going up and down. Makes it easy on the legs. Take the time to wander arount Montjuic park. It's very lovely!!!!

BARCELONA'S ANSWER TO THE PRADO. Forget the Sagrada Familia, this museum is the best place to hang out in Barcelona. The Romanesque collection is stupendous--even more meaningful if you've visited some of the stone churches that originally housed the frescoes transplanted here. The Spanish Baroque period is also well represented. Also a good numismatics display. The building itself is a wonderful showcase for the art. An excellent rainy day haven.

Museum and much more. Great museum and were introduced to a local photographer of the 1950's through this and bought couple of his posters - Joan Collum. Walk down the many, many steps and take in the views. They have a firework display at night.

Interesting. It really worth to walk until the top of Montjuich, were you can enjoy one of the best museums in the city. There are allways very interesting temporal exhibitions and the views from the top are just amazing!

Must-see Museum in Barcelona. Stunningly beautiful collection of art of Catalunya. I personally found the contemporary and modern art the most intriguing. It is free with the Barcelona Card, as of many other museums. but this alone, is worth great value. Also, Saturdays, free from 3pm onwards. 30% discount for students.
very beautiful place. very beautiful place, and the magic fountains were amazing in the evening a must see, but get there early as it gets very busy
Beautiful park around the museum. We didn't visit the museum but spent the day in the park surrounding it. It offers an amazing view of the magic fountain and the plaza de Espanya
Excellent views & museum. Located overlooking the city of Barcelona. Stunning views of the city and well worth the visit. Short walk to the Olympic stadium

Beautiful. Another place that is stunning even from the outside! Wonderful trip inside and out. The best part was it was free the weekend we were there! It was celebrate the city weekend and all museums were free

beautiful building. Only 12 euros and great on a rainy afternoon. the best bit was viewing all the art that was saved from Churches. Amazing the lengths they went to for these works of art. We would have loved to see the light show for the fountain but it wasn't operating on a weds. It was till magnificent. Loved the outside escalators to help up to the top.
An interesting museum in sprawling rooms. A bit of a walk from the train station but well worth it. We didn't realise that there would be free entry after 3pm on Saturdays.

beautiful view of the city . We went via the hop on hop off bus... It was really hot and expect to climb a lot of stairs to get the top. You will find a few people trying to sell you things.. We can across two girls who had asked us to sign a petition for wheel chair access...which we did but we were then asked for money and I declined...one of the sellers came up to us and said in broken English...bad People... I realised the that they were pick pockets...So beware!!! It's a great place to visit. The views are amazing.
well worth the time. MNAC has saved some very beautiful fresco's from decaying sites and they are beautifully displayed. Free entrance for over age 65.

Definitely Worth A Visit. A fabulous building with the best views over the city and very well displayed art collections make this museum definitely worth a visit. The entrance fee is not excessive and overall it is excellent value for money. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and it was nice to visit somewhere without the crowds!
wow. Climb to the top of the majestic fountains and cascades to see a brilliant view of the city.would have liked to watch magic fountains at night but only on tour Fri and Sat evenings.

Visit Sunday afternoon when its free. If you are near Placa Catalunya on Sunday afternoon its worth a visit because starting 3 PM the entrace is free. Its interesting but not as much as other art museums.

Incredible Collection. The views from the terrace are stunning. Inside is a lovely set of collections. The medieval murals from Catalan churches are fascinating. Watch the video about how they took them from the original buildings. The renaissance collection is good. The best part of the museum is the Modernisme and Catalan art. Many beautiful pieces you will not see in any other museum.

Finest Romanesque and Gothic Art. I am an art museum junkie. This is a world class museum. It has the finest Romanesque frescoes I have ever see. Possibly in the world. The Modernist and Gothic are also excellent. The building itself is commanding with a huge lobby and organ. Combine you visit with a trip to the Joan Miro foundation and a trip up the cable car.
A wonderful collection. Impressive collection of Spanish art in a beautiful space with a great view. Also, one of the rare museum book shops where you can find literature on Spanish art in English.

Well worth a visit.. An eclectic mix of art from Romanesque friezes to modern multimedia installations, with furniture, posters and mosaics also on display. The huge oval hall, and the nearby painted cupola with its Miro mural are impressive.

A must visit for history and art lovers. An important museum that contains pieces of arts from different Catalan periods and shows the evolution of art through ages.. It worth the visit and it has a free admission each Saturday from 3 pm to 8:00 pm, the audio guide contains valuable explanation it is for 3.5 €.. Also don't miss the dancing shows on the inside dancing hall
catalunia artists. nice museum with works of catalunic artists . it seems that they almost ignore the other parts of spain and their artists. strange.

worth the entry fee and more. Wether you want to watch the view from the large balcony of this national museum or you want to see the art works house inside or take photographs of the awe inspiring interior of the building, this was one of the most impressive modern buildings I have seen in a long time. The building is stunning, I spent as time time admiring the building as looking at the art. Be warned that it closes early on Sunday afternoons.

The art is spectacular but bring a packed lunch. This museum is huge and well worth the trip, the building is a sight to behold. However, there is hardly anywhere to grab food that isn't a gross sandwich or hot dog (unless you fancy paying over the odds for a 3 course meal in the restaurant). So do yourself a favour and pack something tasty for lunch because you'll be there a while. Also might be worth getting the audio guide as 95% of the placards are in Spanish/Catalan, a few in English but not enough to get the detail.You will also see the magic fountain outside (n.b its only "magical" when seen with lights and music at night).
Amazing!. Very interesting place, include many types of art in ages. You should visit this place to feel yourself close to the history of art!

See if you like art and want a change of pace.. This is a general art museum from ancient to modern. It's open spaces and clean white interior is a welcome break from the tight spaces of the old Gotic and Born neighborhood of Barcelona.

Moving and reverential art, stunning building and view. This is a gorgeous building in a breathtaking setting overlooking Barcelona. I was especially moved by their collection of Medieval Romanesque art (11th-13th centuries) with the church murals that were painstakingly removed and are now exhibited in rounded alcoves that are the exact dimensions of their original locations.

Have to visit on the map!. Stunning place full od different and breath taking masterpieces. Place that you have to visit in the morning cause it's easy to loose track of time there and whole day may beven not enough

Great views and amazing art. Views from the top of the gallery were great looking over the fountains and even if you don't want to go into the gallery itself I'd recommend walking up at least.Building itself is amazing, but the art is great too. I was worried there's be a lot of religious art, but there really was something for everyone - both old and new art. The medieval stuff was cool, but then there was loads of posters and photography stuff on display too. Recommended for anyone with an interest in art.

A wonderful and important museum. . I really enjoyed this museum, particularly the sections on romanesque and Gothic art. The romanesque section is unique and significant for having preserved and recreated rare wall and ceiling paintings from decaying Catalonian rural romanesque churches. I highly recommend at least visiting this section of the museum - it is really well done. I also highly recommend the audio tour; it will make your visit to the museum much more meaningful and enjoyable.

Lovely views of the City and a Unique Art Collection too!. Walking there from Plaza Espana affords some great views of Barcelona. Almost worth it just for the vistas, but the Museu also provides a unique opportunity to see and learn about Catalan art. We were short of time and mainly focused on the art of the middle ages, but the museum itself takes you all the way to modern times. We felt the exhibits were well-presented and the audio guide was very helpful. One of many attractions at the locale. Head up to MNAC and plan to spend the day there and the places around it. And BTW, it is free for Seniors!
Must visit!. It's a beautiful visit to come here.Has the fantastic water fountainsThe escalators make it easy to climb up hillThe art galleries are beautifulArt work is fabulous

Excellent museum, spectacular views. The museum visit for those who love to learn more about history and artifacts. But those who do not want to visit inside, can just enjoy the views from this place.
Art. Art, Art, Art, for art lovers you need more than one visit. organized, customer service excellent, venue impressive

Stunning art, views and surrounds - A highlight of our trip. Our taxi dropped us off at the side of the Museum and as I got to the front of the Museum the view of the city in the background and the landscape and fountain in the foreground made me gasp. You can take the elevator to the roof top bar for a peek which is worthwhile. Once inside my daughter and I were captivated by the Romanesque frescos. There's lots to see and I got a bit worn out after 2 hours so I left her to go to the modern section alone. That was a mistake. Thankfully she came back to tell me I had to see it. The carved furniture and decorative pieces were magnificent. The only downside was the cafe.
Stunning. What an absolutely stunning place this is. The architecture, fountains colours view and fantastic. Well worth the Visit.

Stunning, Superb, Sensational, Bewitching Beyond Words. Even if you did not go inside the museum, just walking around its premises is mesmerising. The main grand fountain, the side fountains, the cascading waterworks flowing down both sides of the steps, the horticulture, the monumental structure with a majestic facade, the lamp posts, the towering pillars at the far end of the museum, the landscape, the colours, the space, the cleanliness...no details is too small and everything is meticulously contrived. the place is so awesome that one will want to stay awhile and admire its absolutely gorgeous architecture. Going inside brings another round of exhilaration and excitement and will satisfy even the most fastidious and frequent museum lover. This MNAC is just BEAUTIFUL and EXQUISITE inside out. This is a MUST SEE if you are in Barcelona. MNAC is one added reason why Barcelona is so amazing apart from their friendly warm people, clean streets, nice shopping and delectable tapas. It is really one of the most breathtaking and alluring attractions we have ever come across given that we've travelled rather extensively through Europe. More adjectives ? Beguiling , glorious , imposing and a knockout!
My Favorite Museum in Barcelona. I loved the MNAC lots of early christian art 11th 12th and 13th century happens to be a favorite time in Europian art history
Loved this museum!. Beautiful building, beautiful art, beautiful grounds......could have spent 2-3 days here, if had the time. I would love to go back!

Stunning!. even if you dont go inside, the outside is absolutely stunning !! Tons of great photo ops, Such a beautiful area with a huge fountain outside as well. Great cafes to sit and people watch. Overall super place that i would not miss.

QUITE SUPERB. This is a stupendous art gallery. Housed in a commanding building perched high upon Montjuic Hill, this palace seems to sprawl and, on first sighting it, you convince yourself you will never see everything. However, whilst we did not, that was because we spent just three hours there. An hour or so longer, and you would see it all. We missed out the Gothic, the Renaissance and the Baroque sections, but saw everything else. My tip is that if you have time for just one section, see the Romanesque exhibits. These largely constitute one-thousand-year-old frescoes rescued from loss or further deterioration by an enlightened Catalonian government from crumbling churches in the Pyrenees last century. These are world-class, and I doubt I have ever seen so many church frescoes of such quality gathered together in one place and displayed so well anywhere in the world, except when in situ. You can also enjoy an interesting trip through the development of art in Catalonia by theme: there are some good artists and sculptors. Look out of the rather mischievous bust of Picasso in unfamiliar mood. If you get chance, get up on the terraced roof for some great views over the city. One downside: the cafe is expensive (4.9 euros for a slice of tart), but that does not detract from this sumptuous gallery of art.

Beautiful Museum. A beautiful museum filled with a wide variety of art and paintings.A short 10-15 min walk from Espanya metro station (on Lines 1,3 and 8).Nice cafe at the top of the terrace right in front of the museum offers nice refreshments. Little food cabins along the way are a bit rubbish with poor quality food.The audio guide was a disappointment. The battery only lasts 1-1.5 hours, which is hardly enough to get you around 1/5th of the museum.Highly recommended for all art lovers.

What an absolutely stunning building, and the art was beautiful as well.. The museum is located right next to the Magic Fountain. (That wasn't really clear from the map I was using).The whole area is amazing and so very beautiful. The Museum building is impressive and that's just the building!I visited the section containing modern art as this is what interests me and it was very interesting and informative. Nicely laid out, signs next to the paintings not too far away to see and helpful summaries telling you more about the lives of the artists. The entrance ticket also includes a visit to the roof which is well worth a visit. If nothing else the 360° views are amazing. There's also a champagne bar complete with music and of course fantastic views so why not have a sit down and relax for a while. One of the sections you have to walk on the get around the building I thought was a bit scary but a deep breath and making myself look forward and not down got me across without too much trouble, i.e. drama! I did have a water in the self service cafeteria and thought it a little expensive, €2.45 for a 33cl bottle is a bit steep in my opinion but I soon realised this was about the going rate in Barcelona.
Pop in and have a look round, worth it.. Yes its another museum but with less, but very good quality exhibits. The views from the steps over the magic fountain are great. Note shuts early on Sundays.
good place if you have time. Togother with the Magic fountain and Montjuic park this is a place where you have to go...It's a great place where you can see the best art in Catalunya.

Outstanding. This is a wonderful collection of artefacts , the white marble sculptures are sublime as is much of the furniture and woodwork. The minimalist approach to display is very effective, you are not faced with dozens of daunting display cases but a selection of high quality exhibits in uncluttered surroundings. Anyone remotely interested in art must visit this museum and of course there is the fabulous view over Barcelona city as a bonus.
Beautiful building and art collection. I was impressed by how big this museum was. There´s pretty much a representation of every art movement. A really outstanding collection. Better than expected

Great exhibits but worth visiting just for the Roof Terrace!. I was lucky enough to visit the MNAC on the National Day of Catalonia and so admission was free but I would have been more than happy to pay! Although a relatively small museum it is easy to spend a good few hours exploring the exhibits, there are some amazing art works and sculptures as you would expect but there were also some surprises such as the collection of Romanesque Art, which featured amazing murals that had been transported from caves and churches throughout Europe. Also, the main Auditorium area is stunning and I found it a welcome break to sit and relax before setting off again on our tour round the building. However, I have to echo other comments to say that a trip to the MNAC would not be complete without a visit to the roof terrace. It is easy to access via the lifts (just be aware you do have to cut through the restaurant which can be a little intimidating when people are eating in there!) however, the views are amazing and it was brilliant to sit and have a few drinks from the pop up bar. I really enjoyed my visit to the MNAC, in fact, that whole area of Barcelona is really beautiful and well worth a visit to see surrounding attractions such as the Olympic stadium and parks. It was also great to see the vista right down to the Fountains which regrettably we didn’t stay to watch as 1.5 million people were descending for the rally but I hope to return again and if so the MNAC will be high on my places to revisit!

Worth visiting. Very nice stuff, especially beautyfull building, and marvelos view over city from the entrance point. All good reasons why to visit this nice museum.Tip: there are free entrance days or regular ocasion, so look for precise informations about this if you want to save on tickets.
Interesting & Informative. Worth exploring expecially on a rainy day. Worth it just to see the views of Barcelona from the steps. Also great access from here to the Olymic Park.

Beautiful Views, Garden and Fountains!. I was pleasantly surprised to see such beautiful architecture with stunning waterfalls designed to complement the site on top of the hill and sloping down to the city. Well worth a visit to see the views of Barcelona city and sea. Lovely shady areas to rest in on a hot day, with live music, cafe and rooftop bar. The museum had some interesting pieces from Roman times. A bonus was the short walk over the road to the Olympic site with more beautiful buildings and views.
A behemoth . No reservations or online tickets required , the museum is huge with a great selection of art pieces and it has a breathtaking view of Barcelona . Absolutely worth the visit .
Beautiful museum. Beautiful museum in the outside and inside. The surroundings are great with all of the fountains and open spaces.

Stunning Artwork, Glorious Architecture and Beautiful Gardens. We went to the museum after a walk around the Olympic stadium and diving centre. The museum is free to enter on a Saturday after 3pm. The views of the city at the main entrance are incredible, especially on a sunny day. My favourite artwork was the Spanish Civil War propaganda, and it was an unexpected surprise to see the Gaudi displays, as well as a Picasso. The gardens down to the Placa de Catalunya (where the old bull ring has been converted into a shopping mall) is breathtaking. Not usually one for art galleries, but this one is a must if you are visiting Barcelona. Highly recommended!

Just great museum!. What a place for a museum. This is just lovely. The collection was set with an excellent taste. There is also a restaurant with a great view but a bit too expensive for my opinion.And a tip, the first sunday of each month and on saturdays after 3 pm, is free entry.
Breathtaking views. We didn't actually see the exhibitions but the building and especially the area is astonishing, the steps from Placa Espanya. And the surrounding park is worth the climb.
Another Gallery! O,o. Great rangeMarred by difficult to follow layoutBeautiful grounds Limited food and drinks onsiteWorth the trip out and on both the tour bus tours

Fabulous Museum and Building. We left this til our last day which was a shame as it was a public holiday and closed at three so it pays to check timings. We had 1.75 hrs so rushed around but I loved what I saw. The medieval sections left me a bit cold though my partner enjoyed them, but the modern art including the modernism section of art and furniture was fantastic. And the building itself in the setting of Monjuic was lovely. Probably my favourite museum in Barcelona.

Great Views, - Lots of Artists & Musicians Around!. We came here with the Barcelona hop on hop off Tour bus, and we were impressed with the view which is breathtaking.Later on that day, we returned for a stroll and more photos and returned on foot climbing down all the way the stairs.The surround area is lively, full of musicians and artists playing and painting. Lots of beautiful works of art on sale.We did not have the time to get inside the Museum though!

Nice views . The view at the top of the mueseum was excellent and plus there is a car park and bus stop at the top so you don't waste walking up and down the stairs sadly the time i arrive was in the evenig so i didn't get enough time to go inside the art mueseum but the entire building is a piece of art
Beautiful. Fabulous architecture, wonderful gardens, amazing view over Barcelona. Incredible fountains. Get there easily on the hop on hop off bus....

Stunning Museum Structure and Grounds. Did not go into the Museum, but you don't need to do so. The grounds are magnificent, wita larger than life palatial building and fountains and waterfalls cascading down the hillside to the street below. Great photo op

Very pleasant surprise. This was not on our list of sights in Barcelona but the interesting building attracted us. Built for a world expo and very well converted into a museum housing old and new art from the Catalan area. Quite a hike up the hill on a hot day if you walk from the metro station but good views from the terrace at the entrance. There is a café will positioned to take in the views. Building is lovely inside and the art is laid out in chronological groupings. Good café at the back for snacks although a little pricey. Interesting collection of art worth seeing.

Wow. On our last morning in Barcelona we decided to visit this building. Wow! We are not really art gallery visitors but we're so impressed with the layout and exhibition pieces. The view from the roof top is also amazing and the waterfalls and setting are out of this world.

Rainy day = no queues & empty museum = YAY!!!. When we got off the metro, we could see the museum from the station and it looked impressive from afar with the fountains & waterfall in front of it. We went in the morning when it had cleared up from all the rain, then we got some good pictures over the city from outside the MNAC before heading inside as it started to rain again. There was absolutely no queue and fantastic spots for photos. However the rooftop was shut which was a bit of a shame due to the bad weather.We got in using free entry from the BCN card and the lady explained that the ticket gives you two entries in one month which is good if you don't finish looking at the museum in a day. We spent 2-3 hours in there and we were really bored (mainly because we have no interest in art). We found the tournée de chat noir & some pablo picasso (woman in hat and fur collar). The wood work is interesting as well. We didn't look at half of the museum as we had a lot to fit into our 5 day itinerary but it would be nice to go back some day and finish looking at the rest of it even if i'm not a big fan of art.If you get time, you should go during the day to see the contrast between the day and night of the fountain, as there is a show font magica in the evening on thursday-sunday from 9.30-11.30pm. Its amazing and crowded in the light/water display.

Very good looking building. The inside content is actually the history and evolution of the catalan area.Also lot of pieces of art.Most of the exhibits are very unique and maintained nicely.Building is itself amazingly beautiful and view of the city from the entrance is really good.There is also a central prayer hall (church) inside and is really nice.

Some works of Pablo Picasso and Antoni Gaudi are here. Very interesting museum. It has some works of Pablo Picasso on display. Antoni Gaudi wood works are also here. Check out the gigantic auditorium they have.
National museum. It is beautiful, has the magic fountain just outside and overlooks the olympic village, so plan early because a trip will take some time and also involve some walking around.
Go go !!. I am not an ART big fan but when i saw the gothic art i was shocked with such beauty ,for beginners u can visit the modern section and take the chance to look at some of GAUDI'S

Beautiful. We didnt get to go inside as we didnt have enough time but the views from outside looking over the city are amazing. Epic walk to the top but there is escalators to aid the climb. I loved it, it was lovely to sit outside and watch the world go by very briefly

Nice architecture and great surroundings . We didn't have the time to go in but we did take the time to visit the building and the hike up the steps for some photos. There are escalators for half the climb but didn't see a ramp to the top so I guess difficult for less able people. The views are great and loads of photo ops.

In Barcelona, this is the mother of all museums. Magnificent! What an incredible sight as you approach it from Placa Espana. Those waterfalls are striking. 2,000 years of art are housed here - it's so big it'll take a whole day of speed-viewing to see everything.
A good collection of Catalunyan and Spanish masters. Do not miss this if you are in Barcelona.

Don't miss this. This is a terrific museum which houses great art work in an outstanding building. I personally liked the Medieval art but there is other art which should appeal to most tastes. There are also places to eat there as well and a fantastic view of Barcelona. We travelled by train and funicular to Parc de Montjuic and then a leisurely walk to the museum but there are also other options.

Strongly recommend!. If you love art and paintings, here you can see works of historical values! Architecture is stunning, from up you have amazing view - whole Barcelona is in front of you! And Magic fountains is something you can't miss!
Huge!. It was so big that i didn't see it all. Saturday after 3 pm, there's free entrance. Its has so many things to see. From roman age till modern. Beautiful!

Beautiful museum, fantastic location and views. We had bruschetta and coffee/sodas in the terrace restaurant and it was fantastic! Beautiful views! Wait staff was very polite and accommodating and at the time we went, it was not very crowded.The museum is beautiful, we stayed about an hour and went through the Modern Art section.

Great museum and view. If you are into art museum this one is a must! It has all the Catalan art in it. It is huge and with great pieces of art. The building is beautiful. It is located in Montjuïc with a great view of part of the city from it. It was one of the pavilions built for the 1929 World's fair in Barcelona.Fantastic place! Worth seeing!

Barcelona's National Art Museum. This grand museum sits high on a hill and offers a panoramic view of the Placa Espania. The museum holds some masterpieces and has art ranging from the medieval times to contemporary art. I especially enjoyed the propaganda posters designed during the Spanish Civil War. And, there's an outstanding restaurant with commanding views; plus, it's must 12 Euros to get in.

Rather boring. I get that this might be cool when the fontains are on but the other evenings it is very sparsely lit. sadly the evening when we were able to visit there was no fountain show and it was more of a snap-a-pic-and-leave kind of thing

Amazing. Must see and spend some time to admire all different collections. perhaps, it is not so much advertised as other sites but it is worth a visit. The building is in a beautiful location, close to the magic fountains , on the top of a small smooth hill. Don't let the steps drive you away, there are escalators too..

Brilliant!. The museum is a must if you are in the area! A beautiful building full of wonderful works of art. Worth spending a good few hours in. Completely wheelchair accessible. We have never seen so many stair lifts in one building. The staff were very helpful too.

Nice museum . We visited this on a Saturday afternoon (and it was free at this time!) whilst it was beginning to rain on a visit to the Montjuic Park. It was a nice museum with a good collection. Being someone who doesn't particularly enjoy looking at art, I did enjoy the medieval art galleries where there was some rather entertaining pieces.
Wonderful. Fabulous architectures lol the tourists add to the excitement and the vendors on the way trying to sell you a selfie stick are amusing
Fab. I love the view from the top of the hill and the park around, whole building looks impressive. Worth to visit.
Nice Gallery and city view. it was a very nice place, calm and quite gallery and you can go top of the hall by lift and see a wonderful city view of barcelona
Picturesque, worth visiting just for the outside. It was closed when we were there but it was worth hiking to in order to take pictures of the fountains and the exterior. Very pretty place.
Insanely beautiful. It's amazing from the bottom but from the top you have the best views of Barcelona. You have to visit it during the day and at night, both views are really nice
Very lovely!!. This museum is really lovely and the view from the Museum is so beautiful. There is an outdoor area to sit and have coffee or something cold to drink.

Well worth the visit!. We didn't initially intend to visit this art museum, but we are so glad that we did!
The art work was so beautifully presented and it was lovely to learn more about past and present artists.
I would say this museum is more for adults or teens with an interest in art/performing arts.
Ultimate Barcelona. We visited as part of a sightseeing trip to the city, whilst waiting for the Magical Fountains show to start.

A national treasure. Shared this with friends from Adelaide who were blown away...they intended to give this Museum 2 hours and spent so many more enjoying the experience....coupled with the ride from Mt Jouic over the harbour they were enraptured...

Great Views. Amazing Attraction!. We stopped at the Barcelona City Tours bus stop at the top of the MNAC and walked down the stairs. The view of the city is breathtaking and we made some amazing photos there!

Museum with a view. The view from the museum is amazing! My husband and I rented bikes and rode up here. One big hill! The museum was large, and filled with amazing artwork. We went to the roof. We were the only ones up there, but we don't know why. It's SO worth it. You see all of Barcelona and the path down lets you see parts of the park and the Olympic Stadium. Go up there!! We spent about an hour and a half there, but you can spend much longer. Please note: if you are a teacher, bring your ID. You get in for free! I wish I would've known! I didn't have my ID. Next time.....

A magnificent walk up and into the Museu Nacional D'Art. The building housing the Museu Nacional D'Art is a work of art in itself. A beautiful space to spend an hour or two with a fascinating collection of the work of Catalunya artists. Staff helpful and welcoming.

Building more impressive than the contents. Fabulous domed building, well worth seeing in itself,up flights of steps with curtains of water and flowing fountains. One can sit outside, where there's a cafe, admire the view,listen to a busker playing Spanish guitar and chill (until the coaches full of tourists with their selfie sticks appear. As always get to museums early is my advice).Inside,the museum has, effectively,two parts: medieval art, which is entirely religious, and modern art, much more interesting,in my opinion.Even so, being a museum of Catalan art, there were few artists that I'd heard of; One Picasso, and some interesting furniture by Gaudi, but no Dali, for instance.That said,there was some good stuff, especially from around the 1900s.

Excellent Museum. Be prepared to climb many stairs on the exterior and then many more in the interior. The exhibits are very good but we also enjoyed the building itself. We found the steps leading to the roof and followed the boardwalk around the dome to the rear of the building with views of the garden.

Nice building, not brilliant inside. We went as a family of four, two children 18 and 14. Let me start with the positives: the walk up to the MNAC is lovely, as are the fountains (where were on but not in "magic" mode when we walked past). As you can see from the pictures, it involves a bit of a hike up some steps, so those with mobility issues might want to check on that.Great views out over Barcelona from the area just outside the main building, so if you just want to come and stroll around and take photos then great.We had also bought tickets for the actual museum - which is divided into different sections, Roman, Gothic, Modern etc - and I had lashed out on audio guides for us in the hope that they would "bring the art to life."Without wishing to sound a Philistine (and I have watched my share of BBC4 art documentaries) the repetitive sight of solemn Jesuses and Marys surrounded by saints soon began to pall. And the audio guide didn't save the day - pretty dry stuff. So we swiftly moved on to Impressionism and Modern - a bit better, some Gaudi furniture (but you can get a better idea of that at Casa Batila and others), one Picasso which is fine as far as it goes. I was more drawn to the Civil War propaganda posters which were pretty dramatic but our willingness to continue was waning rapidly - even though we were only trying to do the highlights and pretty much had the place to ourselves at about 6pmMaybe we should have done the photography exhibition instead, but about 40 minutes after walking in we were walking back out again.There's nothing "wrong" with what's on show here, its just that many cities have many better exhibits and its underwhelming in comparison.So we went to see some art and ended up having nice walk in the sunshine - as others have said, you don't really have to go inside to have a nice time here.

Excellent photo opportunity and great views. What a great place to visit for the perfect photo opportunities. The views are oustanding and the grounds are just beautiful, especially with these cascading falls and fountains. On a warm clear day, this place takes some beating as the perfect place to visit for you holiday snaps and overall view of the City. The inside is also nice, if you are in to art, but the outside is just lovely and a must for your sight-seeing visit

Worth a visit. We went just for the outside but went in by chance to go to the restaurant . The exterior water features are not to be missed! There are escalators up the side enabling access for the elderly, there are lots of steps so they were also welcomed by the young!!Warning- magic fountain does not operate every evening and starts on a Thursday so try to plan round it!!

Amazing . The magic fountain this museum just completes barcelona. Once in the playa espania area you can walk and see the magic fountain which has a show on at 9pm which is not to be missed. A short walk from there is the Olympic site with stadium And botanical gardens. They can all be visited after each other as its walking distance from each other. Lovely area for photo shoots !

You don't even have to go inside to enjoy it here!. One of the top places in Barcelona for photos, the museum of art is not only for the art lovers but for the whole public. When I was visiting not a lot of people went inside but the most were actually outside sitting on the steps, listening to some music a guy was playing on his guitar and enjoying themselves while a lot was taking photos of the awe inspiring scenery one gets when you are at the top. The nice thing is people with disabilities can easily get to the top as well since there are escalators up and down. When you are done you can go down again and get something to drink or eat at the kiosks downstairs near the fountain!

Go in the morning and night. In the morning you can admire the sheer scale of the building and at night you can snuggle up to the fountain at the bottom of the steps for a music synced water fountain. beware of pick pockets though

amazing frescoes from romanesque churches. The romanesque section is one of the most amazing sections of any museum anywhere. There's also some remarkable retables and sculptures in the gothic section. Rest of museum is less remarkable but still worth it for the lovely building and the views of barcelona.

great place to enjoy view, garden and art.. Great place to have an amazing view on Barcelona. Reminds me of the Place du Trocadero in Paris where you see Plaza de Espanya instead of the Eiffel Tower. You appreciate it so much that you waste your time outside, whereas everything happens inside. A must-see !

Stairs,stairs,stairs :D. First you can see are stairs...Soooo many stairs in old type...Make a big impression :) It's really easy to go there, its close to plaza Espana :) At day time you should go on normal stairs so you can look everything good.Architecture are amazing...It.s really really big ,and when you finally get up you can see beautifull view Barcelona...There's many trees and green and place you can sit and just rest...Evening time it's really nice to go there and just rest...There's some players music so it's really nice... You can find some place for you, not so many people thath it would be immpossible :) But you must have really more time becouse walking upstairs taking time, and you need time for watching and enter the musem.Entering its not much expensive so I think it's really worth it :)

Impressive. Large building of nice architecture, quite massive, impressive but nice.Beautiful garden, with nice stone stairs, cascades etc. A very interesting selection of trees that create a special atmosphere all around.From particular spots offering you different angles of view, you can have a dominating sight over the city, and by a beautiful clear day, it was very nice indeed.Busy place!
Incredible.... A place not to forget to see....not only for the masterpieces you can see (from medieval artist to Picasso and other) but aldo for the building and the big 'anfitheatre' inside....

beautiful view over the city. Beautiful. Not actually open when I was there in the evening about 8pm. But a great place to share a bottle of wine and sit and watch the view and the sunset. walk down past the fountains to catch the bus. the foundtians weren't on when I was there. but that made for a lovely atmosphere. less busy I expect. I would go back just to see the magic fountains.
Best Museum in Europe. You have to visit it!! Amazing!! Best place in Barcelona together with Sagrada Familia church. The place and the paintings are magical!!

Beautiful Modern Art collection and impressive building. The entrance fee is 12€, it is affordable. BUT It is free every Saturday from 3pm to 8 pm !The museum is really big so you never feel it is overcrowded. There is a central patio/event theatre that is impressive.You can go to the roof and walk around it following a little tour.I am not interested in Roman/Gothic religious art but these sections are quite rich of pieces for the amateurs.I was interested in Modern art and was not disappointed. The modern art collection is rich and impressive.

Live and learn. We were able to get there late on a Sunday and didnt realize it was going to close but from the looks of the material available in the book store,it looked as cool and complete a collection as the Met in NYC. They even let you in just to eat and cool off. Just remember it is a HAUL to get to even with an escalator system. If you are in bad shape or have a bad heart... think twice if you take the metro. There is a bus....150 or 55 that goes there and it's a nice ride. You live and learn.

Nice view on the roof. Nice museum, if you like the art in the churches. The rest is pretty ok. May not need audio sets. Enjoy the roof top view, which is the best part of the visit, but no picnic. Not very many food available around anyway.
Mommy and daughter. BEautiful views! Totally worth the walk , it is very beautiful!! We personally did not go inside, but please do!

Great museum of Catalonian art.. We loved this museum. On the first floor are the galleries of Gothic and Romanesque art - a wonderful collection in itself, but where the museum really shone was in their collection of "modern" art, starting around the mid-to-late 1800's, and the educational bonus of having explanations on the walls of why those particular pictures were displayed in that particular room. It shows the rise of Catalonian "modernisme", which in France would have corresponded with "art nouveau". We discovered many great painters that we weren't familiar with. Very much worth a trip!

Very nice collection of art. The MNAC is located just above Plaza Espanya and magic fountain. There are (long) stairs starting from the plaza to the MNAC and the view on the way od the city is very nice.Another good way to get there by foot is via Montjuic (which is accessible by bus, foot, or the funicular).The view from the MNAC to the city is very nice, and it is recommended to sit for a while on the `balcony` in front of the MNAC (specially on evening), to rest and enjoy.I enjoyed the museum itself very much. There is a large exhibition of paintings and there were enough paintings I liked to stop in front of them, return to them for seconds and fill several hours.There is a also a cheap cafeteria and restaurant inside the MNAC where you can buy a decent lunch in addition to a stand outside of the MNAC.
Waowww. Big walk to go up to the museum... But realy ghave to do this...no doubt....love the surroundings of the building...
Wonderful Museum. I love museums and this one has a wonderful collection. The building that houses the collection is almost worth the visit by itself.

Stunning!. Breathtaking building. Designed by Gaudi. Lots of vivid colour in the various mosaics. Lots of sculptural details such as flowers, horses, birds. A beautiful coloured dome at the top level. The back of the stage has wonderful sculptures of women playing instruments. The outside of the building is also superb. A must see.

The Views are Breathtaking. I didn't visit the inside of the museum, but this place is worth a visit for the views of Barcelona it offers. There's a cafe and seating outside the entrance of the museum, where you can sit and see a large expanse of the city.

Excellent Historic Artistic View. I had a great time looking at catalan art! They have good hours and a lovely location. The view from the Museum is of Placa Catalunya and the magic fountain. It's a great mid-day activity and resting point.

Only saw from the outside.. This is an incredible building with a lovely facade. It sits up on the hill from he Magic Fountain and the view doesn't ge Much better. Go and see it day or night you won't be disappointed.
Greats views of Barca. Either day or night, the exterior of the Museum shines with great views of Barcelona. Quite a relaxing space to be in.
Fountains are amazing. Visit on a Thurs/Fri/Sat/Sun and wait until 9pm....a magical and amazing light show of fountains is well worth the visit.

Wish I had more time there. Although we did not go in as we arrived 30 minutes before closing, we did admire the view of the city from here. It looks down on the Magic Fountain....a man was playing his keyboard, refreshment stands were there, a great place to take a break, absorb the sights and sounds.

Wonderful collection. Wonderful museum with lots of art. The best part was probably the exhibition of their modern art collection. The Medieval art was fascinating too, however everyone has different preferences. Worth a visit and needs at least 2 hours.

Beautiful art in a building with incredible views.. Some truly amazing and beautiful exhibits of both medieval and modern art. We were here for 2 hours but could have spend many hours here if we wished. Some absolutely incredible views from outside the building. Incredible value for money compared to many of the attractions in Barcelona

Amazing. Such a great museum and worth a trip. Best to go first thing in the morning when it is quieter. Great location for pictures.
There is also a food stall outside which sell tasty chocolate croissants.

Cultural highlight. We spent four hours here! It was great to see church murals set up in 'mock' interiors. The modern section was also great. Lovely building with super views over city. Those with vertigo will not enjoy the heights, though!

Collection of Arts and a point to view a busy city. We bought the Barcelona card and with this card, the entrance was free. It was really a nice collection of arts that we even forgot to take the pictures inside the museum. From outside, you can have a look of beautiful busy city, Barcelona

Highlight of our visit!. A truly awesome museum in a great part of town. So many beautiful parks all around it. You can take a funicular up to the museum, or simply walk, depending on where you are coming from. The parks throughout are wonderful and different. Hada wonderful time at the museum and the area.

Unique Collections and a Great View. We toured two wings of the museum - the Gothic art wing and the Modern art wing. The Gothic art section is interesting, but fairly repetitive since most of it shows similar altars saved from centuries-old churches. Most of the signage in the Gothic section is in Catalan or Spanish, so a guide would be helpful if you can't read in one of those languages. The Modern art area focus a lot of attention, rightly so, on Gaudi and art that he influenced. A section on propaganda from the Spanish Civil War was unique and interesting. The outside steps of the museum is a great place to get a view of Barcelona.
A very impressive museum. The way to the museum is beautiful, the fountains, all the area around and the museum itself. I am not so fond of museums but this one was impressive for me and not too big.

Impressive. The view is spectacular: I believe this museum is on a hill and the view of the city below is definitely a picture moment. I was also very impressed with the collection. While I only had a chance to view Renaissance era paintings, the collection is huge and the paintings are so breathtaking (the colors, the detail). I also appreciated how close they allowed patrons to be: in the US, the paintings are usually behind some kind of security device, but here, they allow patrons to get close to the paintings. Wonderful museum (you won't regret going here). Btw, on one day (can't remember when), entrance is free.

Something different for Art Museum goers. Just getting to the Museum through all the fountains is a treat and the view is wonderful. I have never seen a finer collection of Romanesque and Gothic art. I liked the fact that the collection specialized in a few types of art. There's a lot more to see, but that was my favorite.
Barcelona's top museum. We spent a full day on Monjuic - lots to see - this was one of the highlights. A top notch selection of Catalan art, well displayed.

All Catalunya Art Ages in one place. If you are an art entusiast and you love history this is the place that you cannot miss during the visit in Barcelona. From Middle Ages to Modern and Present times. All in one representative spot near the Placa the Espanya. The building especially build for the World Exhibition in the begining of the 20th century. You will find there artworks of famous Spanish artists such as Dalií, Velázquez as well Gaudí, Mariano Fortuny. Also there is a great viewpoint available for the visitors from where fantastic view for the Barcelona is possible.

Fantastic building and view.. Just walking up to and around this majestic building and looking at the view of the city is inspirational. Lovely surroundings. Just be aware that escalators only take you half way up. We went in the evening when the magic fountain was starting.

One of BCN's best museums. Definitely a lot to see here! We began with the Romanesque exhibit that was extremely well demonstrated. The modern art collection is also spectacular. You need about half-day here at least. There are escalators all the way up but if you have special needs (wheel chair, elderly) then it is probably easiest to have a taxi take you directly to the entrance.Free entrance if you are over 65.

High, and nice place. This place is a museum and the entrance is cheaper, around 10euros for one adult, but will have discount if you are youth or student. Especially, the exterior place is magnificent, placed on a hill near plaza espana. You can have the view of Tibitabo and arena, and most of Barcelona.

The rooftop bar and restaurant are a must-visit!. A good selection of older fine art and sculptures from a range of periods. The rooftop Moet bar was lovely - stunning views and a really nice barman! The restaurant was amazing, good service and food at amazingly reasonable prices! Would highly recommend for the rooftop views alone!

An art lover's dream. We visited this museum on a Sunday afternoon as it was free at this time. We were breath taken as soon as we left the station; the exterior is magnificent, placed on a hill in order to further emphasise its glory. After scaling the steps (or cheating and taking the escalators, a nice touch for an especially hot day) you will find an almost panoramic view of the city. If you're not interested in art at least visit for this, as there is nothing quite like it. As an art student I really enjoyed the collection. The style of the Renaissance works is unique, and differs in style from what I have previously seen in Northern European and Italian galleries. The Romanesque work was equally interesting and different. However, my favourite part was the contemporary collection. It's curation was really good and broke down the works into sections. My favourite pieces include the Art Deco works and the 'civilisation' video. I was equally impressed with the gift shop which sold some beautiful items at affordable prices.. I went a bit crazy with postcards!Overall I would definitely recommend this gallery, it is beautiful as well as manageable, and the fact that it was free made it all the more better.

Spectacular view in Barcelona . Best place I have been to in Bareclona. The way leading up to the museum is just gorgeous. And the view from the top cures every broken soul. I never wanted to leave the venue. This is where I fell in love with Barcelona. The museum is not so bad either.

Unexpected beautiful installation of frescos. This is a beautiful museum installation, full of lovely modernism objects that leads to an up-close understanding but the real stand out is the installation of medieval frescoes in spaces that reproduce the original architecture. Was not expecting to have such a great experience

Beautiful museum. Beautiful museum very well organised. They are very few pieces in each room which is wonderful because you can admire each of them individually. However, the descriptions are only in spanish...
Beautiful view. I was there at night and did not visit the inside. But the view combined with the fountain is really beatiful. I suggest this place

It's art on the outside and on the inside. Loved the exposed art, loved the spaces, loved the recreations of the churches. Is amazing to see everything in one place. Look at the timetable, after 15h at sundays is free!!

Nice view from outside. Even if you are not into art, this is worth visiting for the view from the top of the steps. Provides a fantastic view over Barcelona. Can easily be combined with a visit to the Olympic Stadium which is nearby.
A must see for the art lover. An interesting, large collection. We did not leave ourselves enough time - was there for 2 hours, could easily have spent another hour there.

Stunning Views. The MNAC is stunning from the outside. It’s quite a walk to get there from Espanya Metro station, but the views are worth the walk! When you climb up to the entrance level, you can see the Magic Fountain and many other landmarks.The museum itself displays many works of art from a wide range of time periods, from Roman times through to modern art.For even more stunning views, I would recommend visiting the rooftop. There is a terrace bar on the roof and a restaurant (Oleum), which also have great views.If you are planning on visiting this and other museums, it may be worth looking into buying an Articket which costs 30 euros, and gives you access to MNAC and 5 others.

The Museum has the best views of the City.. Our family visited Barcelona during hot summer month and there was so many tourists. We used the hop on hop off bus to get us to the sites and this was perfect. However, the museum closes early on Sundays and we didnt see the inside. There was a bar and souvenir shop just outside its doors who were ready for the crowd of people who gather at sunset for the best views of the city and of the magic fountain show. We took the metro subway train back to our hotel after the fountain show ended and it was so worth it.

Great Art and Gallery. Overlooking the city of Barcelona, you must visit this Gallery which has everything from Medieval to Modern. You may be Churched out or Galleried out from a European vacation, but enjoy this one of a kind Gallery. Fantastic

Lovely,Enchanting, Romantic. Oh My God! - This was my first impression! You would need a full day to experience the loveliness and the greatness of this place. Just don't stop with the views and photos. Take time to see all about this place, when and how was it built and by whom and for what purpose and on!This is one of the best places in Europe I had ever visited. The fountains are a great work. We went right upto the top of the Musuem. So - if you want to visit this place - Don't go unprepared.Visit the website - http://www.museunacional.cat/en/museumLearn all about the place and go planned. Unplanned will ensure you will miss many things. There is so much to see, so much to do based on who you are at this place. ! And - if you are a photographer - you are at the place where you should be! Don't miss this out. Behind the museum are multiple places to see and small small shops. lovely restaurants with a great ambience.

Great introduction to the art of Modernism. A well thought-out set of permanent exhibitions that provide a solid background for understanding the development of Modernism in the city. We visited here before we went to the Gaudi sites, and my partner, who doesn't have much of a background in anything 'arty', found that he learnt something that helped him to unlock the other galleries and architecture we saw across the city. Worthwhile, and you should definitely consider getting in on the 'Art Passport'.

Amazing from every point of view. The art collection is extensive, comprehensive and amazing. We spent more than three hours there enjoying everything from medieval art to Dali. Be prepared for a 3 hours plus tour. Have lunch before you get to the museum otherwise you might not make it and start nibbling on the paintings. We will go back there on our next visit to Barcelona.

A fascinating museum. I really loved this museum. It had a huge collection of medieval religious art, which vas very interesting. So was the collection of modern art, which was organized thematically rather than by artists. It had some interesting artworks, and gave a good insight into the modern Spanish history of art.

A nice visit. Great exhibits (there's lots of them). Mostly for teenagers/adults as children may get bored looking at paintings. Definitely value for the ticket price. Also a nice sit-in snacks area, as well as a beautiful view outside the museum!
Superb Fountains. The view and structure of the fountains was breathtaking. Magnificent views and well worth the trip to see and going right to the top.
Great views and well organized galleries!. Worth the visit just for the city views. Galleries were easy to go through and informational. Gives a good sense of spanish art and artists.

Stunning views. There are escalators to help you reach the museum at the top of the hill and the views over Placa Espanya are pretty fantastic. We visited on a Sunday during its free period. Walking in was bliss after the intense heat outside. However, unless you’re interested in Catalan Art this museum may not keep you entertained for very long. Some of the art was great but a lot wasn’t to my taste so we only spent 45 minutes there. Also, the café is extortionate, bring your own drinks!

Romanesque art. Absolute must see for admirers of romanesque art. They have preserved inside the building gorgeous frescoes from the early middle ages that originally were in the romanic churches in the Pyrenes. Also, excellent collection of paintings.

Fascinating ancient art. beautiful building and great atmosphere near plaza espanyol. The artwork was undoubtedly impressive, and the audio guide offered some really interesting insights and was worth the extra few euros, although not all sections of the collection has audio which was a shame. The collection is vast with a lot of the works seemingly coming from churches or depicting religious themes, although there is also modern art represented.

cool and free. friends and I were riding the Hop on Hop Off bus in Barcelona and this is one of the stops, beautiful views of the city, turns out it was past 3pm and entrance was free, and it was a HOT day so walking around in the coolness of the place was an added bonus, lovely collection of religious art, loved the ballroom and nice little cafeteria, the views alone were worth the ride up the mountain, walking down the series of steps is fabulous too!

What no ice??. We walked up to this very impressive and imposing museum from the main playa on a roasting hot day. Up the escalators and stairs to the outdoor café area in desperate need of a cold drink. Incredibly the caravan stall did not serve cold drinks with ice! In over 100 degree heat this was astounding! The view from the outside patio across the city and up to the mountains was spectacular and with the musician playing his Spanish guitar to the seated crowd, the atmosphere was just fabulous. A must visit location on your trip to Barcelona and we were sorry to miss the water fountain display at 9pm each evening which had been recommended to us.

Beautiful inside. If you can walk up the stairs without panting, you are in good shape. The waterfall outside is pretty spectacular. Once inside, you will be rewarded with a surprise akin to the British Museum in London. This building was built for an international fair and in the middle of it, there is what looks like a Roman colosseum. The architecture, not the art is the main attraction.

Spectacular Views. We did not go inside and just happened upon this building. We were at the Olympic Museum and wanted to go back a different way and wound up at these magnificent stairs and water feature that are so big and grand, there aren't words to describe. It was a pleasant surprise.
Beautiful Site. We did not go into the museum but it's exterior is stunning architecturally. It is located on Montjuic. So when you are visiting the Olympic site be sure not to miss this building.

Good exhibitions but expected a little more?. We got a bit lost trying to find this from University Metro station, the signposting wasn't too great. The place itself is very modern in design and split across 3 floors with galleries off from the main foyer, but I think we were expecting a bit more to it, glad it was free on the Barcelona Card, although there were a few I inspiring displays and exhibits based on your preferences.

If you like history and fine arts, visit this place. If you like the Romanesque art and wish to find out how these wonderful pieces were discovered and transferred to here, visit this wonderful museum. It is located on the top of the hill in Montijuic. You could see the nearly entire city from the front gate and this view itself is worth visiting here. Since it is massive, we decided to stay with the Romanesque masterpieces (frescos, woodcarving, and painted alter frontals), many of which came from old churches in Pyrenean mountains and villages (where we visited after Barcelona). We were impressed by the way the museum displayed all pieces and the entire experience can be descibed as 'mysterious' and serene. Although we did not visit any other place in Montjuic, there are many other exciting things that you could do around here.

Check out the White Night. Surprisingly modern and airy inside despite its dull stone coloured exterior. Great views of Barcelona from here. Look out for the exceptional White Night, and other Night at the Museum free events as these are exceptional. A mix of drinks, food, music, theatre and art.

Treasures galore..... It was my good fortune to visit the museum on a Sunday, which meant it was free to the public. The works of art were amazing, from the brass pieces, to the Renaissance works of art, to the pieces saved from the Roman era and the year 880 and up - truly amazing....and to think I found it by accident, basically. You're allowed to take pictures, but without a flash - which isn't an issue because it's very well lit. The staff there are quite helpful, and really want to help and understand English, and seemed to take a great deal of pride in what they knew. I hadn't planned on it, but I spent over 3 hours there - well worth the time!

Beautiful museum. The Museum of Catalan Art is situated on the slope of Montjuci, so either you take the stairs or the mechanic ones. However, it is a very beautiful walk and, at the top, you will have a splendid view of the city. The building itself is very beautiful, yet very modern regarding the refurbishment. Even if the section with modern art is much appreciated by the tourists, for instance the furniture and the glass from the catalan modernist era, one must not forget the spectacular medieval paintings from different churches in this country, hence the roman art.

This stands out among the world's art museums for its collections and quality.. We liked the diversity of Catalunya and how the museum was laced out. It was great that we were allowed to take pictures of most everything.It's a great museum.

Just sat outside. We got off here during the Hop on Hop off bus tour. We didn't go into the museum. We sat out side and soaked in the amazing atmosphere enjoying a beer and sangria. The views are amazing! We were entertained by street musicians who were excellent.
beutiful building and grounds. Absolutely lovely place to visit, the walk up is amazing in itself, definitely worth and afternoon and great to get out of the sun while looking at the wonderful art.
Beautiful View!. It is a beautiful building but even better it is at the top of the hill giving a beautiful view of the entire city.
Great time for our group . Informative and educational. Great photo opportunity here too. The staff were friendly and the services met our needs.

A wide selection of art. I wish we would have had more time. It is beautifully positioned on the hill with a view of the city. There are different sections which need a lot of time to peruse. We spent a fair amount of our time in the reconstructed churches area. Quite amazing. Give yourself enough time to go through everything and preferably buy a museum booklet which allows you to visit lots of museums within a timeframe. Worth it!

Impressive and up to date. We already came here 13 years ago. The museum was new then and still is in a very good shape. And it has been updated. Even for children, there is enough to experience, they are not bored, eben if they are not reading all the background information.And compared to other attractions, it is really not expensive.

Beautiful building!. This gallery is set in an exquisite building with great architecture and surrounding gardens that affords a beautiful view over Barcelona. I wasn't overwhelmed by the collection but it is probably still worth a visit. The building and gardens are definitely worth viewing!

Fantastic art museum. Amazing art museum. The left side of the museum is all Catalan art - really interesting to see since it's not something found in other museums. The right side goes into more well known artists and the modern art section is awesome as they set it up so the viewer pretty much gets a little art history lesson. That was my favourite section! Entry is 12 euros for adults, however families with children under 16 get a discounted rate, so it cost us 8.50 euros per person and my 16 year old sister was free. There is a cafe and a restaurant. The cafe also has a buffet section for 14 euros all you can eat. The restaurant was much more pricey (think find dining) You also have access to the rooftop terrace which is lovely and has incredible views of Barcelona. Fantastic art and lovely building - please do not miss this!!!

Impressive Architecture. Very impressive approach and fantastic architecture. Fountains, columns and waterfalls on the approach to a beautiful building that used to be a palace and certainly looks the part. Good collection with some interesting pieces, but I wasn't personally inspired by the art and preferred the outside if I'm honest. Nice way to spend a morning. Reasonable price at around 12E and can be used for a second day during your stay.

Great location, Interesting Collection. Since I have free access with the ICOM card, I thought I would give this museum a try. The collection did not disappoint and I spent almost 2-3 hours within the compounds. Not to mention this museum is nestle on a hill which offers a fantastic view of the city.

Perfect Place to get engaged!. Overlooking Barcelona, on the stairs leading to Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya at sunset, my fiancé proposed to me. The setting couldn't have been better (he did an amazing job!) The grounds are beautiful we spent three evenings in the area on our trip. One evening we went into the Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya but didn't have nearly enough time to see everything. Allow yourself plenty of time! What we did manage to see was very interesting but there is a lack of English explanation on exhibit pieces.

Beautiful architecture and surrounding gardens - great at night with the fountains!. We didnt actually have time to visit this museum though I have read that it is well reviewed and holds a great collection of work so definately worth a visit. The building in itself is beautiful and striking at the top of a high hill with several steps to the top - shame they added the escalators too did they really need them?Regardless go at night take in the fountains and this building and the views of the city and the plaza are stunning from the top!

Great museum. My daughter said it was like a mini-version of the New York Metropolitan Museum, and in many ways, I would agree - though she zipped through the three sections of the museum much faster than me and her elder sister. I wished there was more English in the descriptions, but they did have some English descriptions at the beginnings of each section. I spent more time in the Romanesque and Gothic sections than in the modernist sections - the transplanted frescos are just amazing to look at. It is not surprising, I know, but seeing the gradually increasing complexity of painting from 1000AD to 1900AD was, for me, a powerful reminder of man's cultural evolution.

It's all about the view. I'm not very into art-stuff but came here on the first Sunday of the month as it was free and I was intrigued by the building as I had a good view of it from my hotel room. I can't comment on the art as I really have no idea about it at all (Gaudi probably overshadowed any other artist during my stay anyway) but the views of the city from up there are incredible. Good photo opportunities by the water fountains/waterfall and vividly pink flowers too!

The Like of Which You've Probably Not Seen Before!. I went here on a day when there was almost no-one around (December, just before Christmas) and that makes for a perfect visit. Their Romanesque collection is fabulous, the best I've seen anywhere. The arrangement is spacious and the lighting superb. Photos are permitted. Romanesque can have a hypnotic effect after a time, those eyes peering into your soul... The Gothic collection is almost as good, and again the display is wonderful. Go and have a meal at the top, with a wonderful view over the city, and then take the walkway up to the roof, again a great experience (you can do that even if you are not dining). I was extremely impressed at this museum, not expecting very much when I walked in. Boy was I ever wrong!

Nice for a wander, leave yourself enough time. We rushed this as we arrived later than expected and so we didn't manage to see everything. I'd recommend the second floor with the contemporary art over everything else. The cafe outside is overpriced.

Superb Architecture with Miraculous Views. We never did go inside the museum but we were blown away by the sheer beauty of the outside and all of the surroundings. It's built up in layers so the higher you walk the nicer it gets.There are iconic pillars below showing off the hills in the distance. They have large water fountains with cascading water on different tiers. The building architecture is fabulous to see.

Nice collection. I'm admittedly not a huge art fan, but we did enjoy our 2 hours or so in the museum. It's large but well laid out and possible to take in at a high level in a single go.The general admission ticket was good for all the exhibits and the roof/terrace viewpoint. It was a nice way to spend an afternoon (and the air conditioning didn't hurt).

Didn't go in, but big grounds. Spent an afternoon walking over to this area and mucking about next to the fountains taking pictures with my friends. Very peaceful and relaxing time. In the end went to the top of the escalators and bought a cup of Sangria from the stall there. Then sat and sipped it looking out over Barcelona from up on high in the sunshine. Lovely.

Awesome Views. You have to go to MNAC. The view of Barcelona from MNAC is beautiful. You can also see Sagrada Familia from this location. I think I enjoyed seeing the exterior of the area better than the exhibit.

Jingoistic architecture, patchy collection . First the positives. An extraordinary collection of early religious frescoes and artefacts including 4th ct Coptic textiles and the remnants of 10th to 15th ct frescoes removed from regional parish churches. Also good audio visual of the removal and conservation of same. An good collection of Gaudi furniture and furnishings including amazing doors from Casa Batllo. But the rest of the modern galleries are patchy at best and give compelling reasons as to why Picasso and Miro are the regions foremost artists. With one exception for this viewer: Ramon Casas. A fine artist. The building is neo classical grandismo. Seemingly pointless for anything other than pretension. Disability access, always poor in these buildings, is atrocious with many steps and flights of stairs between galleries and levels. On that note, if you are getting public transport get the bus to the base of the grandiose fountain strewn approach avenue, there are escalators all the way up to the gallery, and then a reasonable sloping ramp to the main door. Bring your own drinks as the franchise out the front specialises in highway robbery.

Art history buff? This place is for you!. Amazing collection of Catalunyan Art from early Romanesque to Modern. The early Church frescos were fascinating. Take your time; the ticket is good for two days. Study the detail in the many paintings--you will be awed. Gawk at the furniture, glass work, ironwork. Fortunys, Mir, Homar, Duran, Fabres,.... Audio guide is highly recommended.

Art Lovers' haven. Housed in an incredibly beautiful building in Montjuic, everything about the museum is a delight and treat to the eyes. Climbing up the steps to the entrance, you get a wonderful view of Placa de Espana and the distant hills. The museum is well-organized with time periods to guide a visitor through a historical perspective of Catalunya art. The early collections of Romanesque, Gothic and Baroque art are truly one of the best in the world. One of the amazing talents we enjoyed is Mariano Fortunys--his work is inspiring and heartbreaking at the same time. And catch Miro's early work--you would not have known he did traditional art.Invest in the audio guide--worth every cent. And take breaks at the cafeteria under the incredible oval roof.We enjoyed ourselves so much we ran out of time. The ticket allows two days of visit but we had to move on from Barcelona....

Terrific collection in a great building above the Magic Fountain of Barcelona!. The collection is superb in all aspects. Allow at least 3 hours!!!
